Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshannover.inform.virusbuster.model.Game

extends java.lang.Object
    Class for the main game logic Created when new game is started
    Author:
    Jannes Hachmer

      • Game

        public Game(int rows,
            int columns,
            int viruses)
        Creates a new game with given number of rows/columns/viruses
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of rows of the game grid
        columns - Number of columns of the game grid
        viruses - Number of viruses present on the game grid

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the field of tiles, viruses and the labels for missing tiles/viruses on the game grid Gets called, when a new Game FXML is loaded

      • reveal

        private void reveal(Tile tile)
        Decides what happens when a tile is revealed Either ends the game when tile is a virus, or shows the Number of adjacent viruses
        Parameters:
        tile - Tile Object that is revealed

      • flag

        private void flag(Tile tile)
        Changes flag status of a tile when rightclicked
        Parameters:
        tile - Selected tile

      • gameover

        private void gameover(boolean won)
        Determines what happens if the player has finished the game Shows Win or Loss screen and gives option to return to the main menu
        Parameters:
        won - True if game is won, or false if game is lost

      • virusCounter

        private void virusCounter(boolean inc)
        Updates value of the virus counter label
        Parameters:
        inc - True if tile was not yet flagged, False if tile was flagged

      • tileCounter

        private void tileCounter()
        Updates value of the tile counter label

      • gameWon

        private boolean gameWon()
        Checks if the game is won or lost
        Returns:
        True if game is won, False if game is lost

      • setUpGameGrid

        private void setUpGameGrid()
        Creates a (rows x columns) grid for all tiles which is placed on the boardPane

      • createTile

        private Tile createTile(int x,
                        int y)
        Creates a single tile and sets the performed action, when mouseclicked
        Parameters:
        x - X-Position of tile
        y - Y-Position of tile
        Returns:
        Returns a single Tile Object
